meanings.definition: The quality or state of being lacy.
meanings.sent1: The laciness of the curtains added elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: She admired the laciness of the doily on the table.
meanings.sent3: The laciness of the spider's web made it look like a delicate piece of art.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had a laciness that reminded him of intricate snowflakes.
meanings.sent5: The laciness of the lace trim on the dress was exquisite.

meanings.definition: The presence of delicate, intricate patterns resembling lace.
meanings.sent1: The laciness of the embroidery on the pillow was stunning.
meanings.sent2: The laciness of the snowflakes on the window created a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent3: The laciness of the cake decoration made it almost too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: The laciness of the tree branches against the sky looked like a lace veil.
meanings.sent5: The laciness of the lace curtains allowed just enough light to filter through.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a light, delicate texture.
meanings.sent1: The laciness of the chiffon fabric made it perfect for the summer dress.
meanings.sent2: The laciness of the pastry made it melt in her mouth.
meanings.sent3: The laciness of the clouds in the sky made her think of cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: The laciness of the soap bubbles floating in the air caught the sunlight beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The laciness of the flower petals gave them a fragile appearance.
